bestBHT.bht: Now that we are no longer living in them, as believers we should also put away the whole set of sinful behaviors, including abusive conversation and foul language. This means avoiding want of charity, kindness in thought and word, and sins of uncleanness. Our speech should be characterized by kindness and purity, and we should separate ourselves from all sins and vices. Let us lay them aside as dead weights, putting off anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication, so that they do not come out of our mouths.

bhtAttempts.bht: As believers, we are called to put away the old sinful habits and behaviors. This includes putting off all forms of abusive conversation and foul language, such as reviling and evil-speaking. Our speech should be characterized by kindness, charity, and purity. It is important for us to separate ourselves from all sins and vices, laying them aside as dead weights and putting them off like filthy garments. We should not let anger, wrath, malice, or any form of filthy communication come out of our mouths. Instead, as Christians, we are to live the new life in Christ, allowing perfect love to cast out both fear and sin.

As believers, we must put away all forms of abusive and foul language. This requires us to intentionally separate ourselves from sins and vices, laying them aside like dead weights. Our speech should be characterized by kindness, charity, and purity. We should not let anger, wrath, malice, or any form of filthy communication come out of our mouths. Instead, as Christians, we are to live the new life in Christ, allowing perfect love to cast out both fear and sin.

Now that we are no longer living in them, as believers we should also put away the whole set of sinful behaviors, including abusive conversation and foul language. This means avoiding want of charity, kindness in thought and word, and sins of uncleanness. Our speech should be characterized by kindness and purity, and we should separate ourselves from all sins and vices. Let us lay them aside as dead weights, putting off anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication, so that they do not come out of our mouths.

As believers, we should put away all sinful behaviors, including foul language and abusive conversation. This means avoiding sins of uncleanness and practicing kindness in thought and word. Our speech should be characterized by purity and charity, separating ourselves from anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication. Let us set aside these sins as dead weights, putting them off like old clothes. By doing so, we reflect the new life we have in Christ and allow perfect love to cast out both fear and sin.

Believers are called to put away all sinful behaviors, including abusive conversation and foul language. We should separate ourselves from anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication, and instead, practice kindness and purity in our words. By putting off these sins like old clothes, we reflect the new life we have in Christ. Our speech should be characterized by charity, allowing perfect love to cast out both fear and sin.
